review: At launch, the chromecast wasn't that great since it only had a few services (Youtube, Netflix, and that's about it) Now that the apps are rolling out, the chromecast is the best gadget to have to turn any tv into a smart tv. The setup is very straightforward and after that you can use your phone, computer, or tablet to cast media to the chromecast! The list of apps are incredible from Hulu, HboGo, Pandora, and others. But the real power in the chromecast is the screen mirroring it can do and the plex media server. Plex costs money but it is the best way to get any downloaded media you have on a device to play on your tv. As for Google Cast through Google Chrome Web Browse, I have yet to run into any issues using the Google Chrome browser on my laptop to cast a tab to my tv. Yes there is lag involved so don't try to do anything too intensive such as playing a game but other than that, Using the Google Chrome Web Browser to cast anything on your tv is incredible! Beats the pants off those other devices and at an incredible price! If you're on the fence about the google chromecast, safely get down (you don't want to hurt yourself, it's a far fall from the fence ask Humpty Dumpty) and buy one ASAP! You won't be dissapointed.

review: The set I purchased this for is an older 1080i HDTV.  It can do 480p, but not 720p or 1080p.Even though there is a way to change Chromecast calls the "Tab picture quality"  to 480p, I could not get a picture at all on this older set.I'm pretty much stuck with my Roku player in 480p mode.I was going to return the Chromecast, however, it works nicely on my smaller 1080p capable TV in the kitchen.  Not that I want to do a lot of streaming in the kitchen, but for $35 I figured "what the hey".So far I have cast stuff from my iPhone using Netflix, HBO Go and YouTube apps with no problems.If you have an older set with no 1080p capability, forget the Chromecast and the Apple TV as well.  You will have to go for a Roku and hook it up to a 1080p capable set just to be able to do the setup and change the output resolution to 480p.Modern devices have no respect for legacy HDTV equipment.
